Job Description
In today's highly competitive financial environment, the financial services industry is faced with significant challenges in the regulatory and legal landscape. To assist our clients with overcoming these challenges, Broadridge offers a comprehensive class action asset recovery solution that helps clients navigate the complexities currently found in the global class action arena.

Broadridge is currently seeking a Research Administrator to join it Global Class Action team. In this position you will work closely with our head of research to assist in the maintenance of its proprietary class action database by facilitating in the identification, analysis, and entry of new asset recovery opportunities, while monitor existing opportunities for key motions and developments. In addition, you will be tasked with ad hoc research projects to support Broadridge’s growing Global Class Action team. You should strive to develop a deep understanding of both securities class action litigation in the US and abroad, including the settlement administration process.

This is an excellent opportunity within our growing Global Class Action team. Are you a self-starter who demonstrates strong initiative? Are you highly organized? If so, we encourage you to read below to learn how you can make an immediate impact within our fast-growing organization.

Responsibilities
- Assist with the maintenance of Broadridge’s proprietary class action database
- Research and monitor court dockets, including summarizing and analyzing specific filings
- Participate and lead custom projects
- Monitor the effectiveness of systems, policies and procedures and make appropriate recommendations to ensure daily operations are efficient
- Work with development teams to enhance and test internal applications
- Have a logical approach to gathering data and analyzing it to solve internal and client inquiries
- Actively participate in acclimating to the role, learning from peers and ensuring accurate understanding of the role and tasks

Qualifications
- JD preferred
- Experience researching litigation including familiarity with court dockets, US civil procedure, and an understanding of various motions together with an ability to quickly discern and digest relevant information
- Self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills
- Demonstrated project management skills including defining of scope, resources and timelines, and managing deliverables
- Strong verbal and written communication skills
- Familiarity with common office software applications (Microsoft Office suite)
- Significant legal and topical research experience
- Attention to detail in a fast-paced work environment
- Global securities class action and/or financial tech industry experience a plus

Due to COVID-19, the majority of our associates are working remotely. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video.

Support services before they go live through activities such as system design, deployment automation, capacity planning and launch reviews.
- Service Management; Align with and directly service internal business units and external clients. Job Description
XBRL, or eXtensible Business Reporting Language, is an XML standard for tagging business and financial reports to increase the visibility and accessibility of business information by using a uniform format. The US GAAP Financial Reporting Taxonomy and the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) Taxonomy are lists of computer-readable tags in XBRL that allow companies to label the thousands of pieces of financial data that are included in financial statements and related footnote disclosures. The tags allow computers to automatically search for and assemble data so those data can be readily accessed and analyzed by investors, analysts, journalists, and the SEC staff.

The XBRL Consultant prepares XBRL exhibits for financial statements, footnote disclosures and financial statement schedules included in Forms 10-Q, 10-K, 20-F and 40-F that are submitted to the SEC. These XBRL files are created using the SEC-approved US GAAP or IFRS Taxonomies for clients from multiple industries, including Oil and Gas, Real Estate, Retail, Mining, Financial Institutions, and others. The XBRL Consultant handles the workflow, communications and timelines for assigned clients on multiple, concurrent projects.

The XBRL Consultant must apply professional accounting skills to select the appropriate tags from the US GAAP and IFRS Taxonomies for each value included in the financial statements, footnote disclosures and financial statement schedules. The XBRL Consultant must use independent judgement and work with clients to figure out reported financial facts map directly to standard taxonomy elements or which ones may require the creation of customized extension elements to complete the XBRL instance document. The XBRL Consultant must review XBRL documents for accuracy, consistency and completeness of data tagging. The XBRL Consultant must also maintain an understanding of current compliance standards promulgated by XBRL US and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to interpret and understand the continuously evolving XBRL compliance requirements in order to address client questions related to their specific compliance requirements.

  • The XBRL Consultant must display excellent written and oral communication skills to communicate well with external customers and demonstrate well-developed organization and interpersonal skills.
  • Meeting customer-initiated deadlines requires the ability to handle multiple tasks and exciting priorities. The XBRL Consultant must demonstrate high proficiency with Microsoft Office products, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint as well as workflow and collaboration software products.
  • The XBRL Consultant must also demonstrate a strong proficiency with the Company’s internally-developed PROfile software.
    The XBRL Consultant maintains a CPA license and completes the required Continuing Professional Education (CPE) requirements of a minimum 40 hours per year to maintain his/her license.
